paragraphs.text: Data extracted from global databases and available across most countries at a national level
View global data for hundreds of indicators spanning every aspect of food systems.
Dive into country and territory specific data, including our food systems diagnostics.
Explore evidence-based interventions that can help improve outcomes of food systems.
Data collected and made available by individual countries and often available for several administrative levels

Country Dashboards show data at the state/province and city level and are available inNigeria,Mozambique,Bangladesh,Pakistan,Kenya, andIndonesia. Work is also underway on Country Dashboards inIndiaandRwanda.

The Countdown is a collaborative effort to monitor global food systems. It brings together indicators that span food systems and provides annual analysis to inform policy, business, and NGO priorities and actions. It supports the transformation of food systems, so they become equitable, sustainable, and resilient and positively contribute to achieving the 2030 SDGs and other global goals.
View data for hand-selected indicators belonging to the Countdown's five thematic areas.
Compare Country-specific data for Countdown indicators to regional and global averages.
Explore how indicators influence and are influenced by each other.
